duck: Reading day - A reading day is a day set aside by a college, university or other school for study for final exams.
Study software - Study software then is any program which allows students to improve the time they spend thinking about, learning and studying that information.
SQ3R - SQ3R or SQRRR is a reading comprehension method named for its five steps: survey, question, read, recite, and review.
Learning - Learning is acquiring new, or modifying and reinforcing existing, knowledge, behaviors, skills, values, or preferences and may involve synthesizing different types of information.
Study guide - Study guides can be broad based to facilitate learning in a number of areas, or be resources that foster comprehension of literature, research topics, history, and other subjects.
Study skills or study strategies are approaches applied to learning.
Homework - Homework, or homework assignment, refers to tasks assigned to students by their teachers to be completed outside of class.

wiki.text:
'Study skills' or study strategies are approaches applied to learning. They
are generally critical to success in school,<ref name="eric1"></ref>
considered essential for acquiring good grades, and useful for learning
throughout one's life.

There are an array of study skills, which may tackle the process of organizing
and taking in new information, retaining information, or dealing with
assessments. They include mnemonics, which aid the retention of lists of
information, effective reading, and concentration techniques,<ref>Bremer, Rod.
The Manual - A guide to the Ultimate Study Method (USM). (Amazon Digital
Services)</ref> as well as efficient notetaking.<ref>http://weblearn.ox.ac.uk/s-
ite/colleges/seh/freshinfo/vs/StudySkills2008b.pdf</ref>

While often left up to the student and their support network, study skills are
increasingly taught in High School and at the University level. A number of
books and websites are available, from works on specific techniques such as Tony
Buzan's books on mind-mapping, to general guides to successful study such as
those by Stella Cottrell.

More broadly, any skill which boosts a person's ability to study and pass exams
can be termed a study skill, and this could include time management and
motivational techniques.

Study Skills are discrete techniques that can be learned, usually in a short
time, and applied to all or most fields of study. They must therefore be
distinguished from strategies that are specific to a particular field of study
e.g. music or technology, and from abilities inherent in the student, such as
aspects of intelligence or learning styles.
wiki.title: study%20skills
